title: Economic Activity
vision: All residents benefit from sustained economic growth and a thriving local economy, and all neighborhoods have vibrant centers of commerce, jobs, and community cohesion

targets.name: Regional competitiveness
targets.content: Regular commuter rail service to Hartford, and scheduled air service from major carriers to Washington, DC and Midwest airports

targets.name: Local jobs, firms, and businesses
targets.content: Retention and construction of sustainable food-based, tech, bioscience, health, and retail business incubators. Increase minority-owned small business participation across the ecosystem by 50%

targets.name: Quality companies
targets.content: Cedar Hill rail yard developed into industrial park and/or inland port by 2018. 100,000 sq. ft. of sub-dividable lab space created downtown by 2019

targets.name: Revitalized neighborhoods
targets.content: Downtown retail occupancy rate increased to 93%. Workforce and/or affordable-housing option incorporated in every mixed-use development project by 2019

charts.chartTitle: Number of New Haven residents who are employed, 2002-2016
